Articles.Content:
According to this Spanish news channel, China has built the world's fastest super computer. An engineer is quoted as saying that, among other uses, this computer will allow them to simulate manned missions to the moon. "This will make their designs safer and more efficient".Their choice of video footage to accompany this is simply hilarious, and not too reassuring on the "safer" part.

http://www.antena3.com/noticias/tecnologia/china-crea-via-lactea-ordenador-mas-rapido-mundo_2013062100018.html (around 0:45 if you can't wait).

Enjoy!
XD that's brilliant
Also brilliant but about 1:02
Chinese government using KSP to practice moon flights? Awesome!
Chinese Space Programme uses best Space Programme. I approve.
China confirmed for Manpatricians.
I bet KSP would still run just as poorly on that supercomputer.

MEHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA...!!!

WHAT THE BALLISTIC ROCKETSHIPS

Calm down, Needles. Calm down.

That. Was. Spectacular.
At least they had the sense to run their advanced simulations with the B9 pack...
What news corporation does this? Do they have no idea at all?

What news corporation does this? Do they have no idea at all?

Antena 3, one of the biggest tv channels in Spain. I watched it live, as I was having dinner, and I almost choked.

Antena 3, one of the biggest tv channels in Spain. I watched it live, as I was having dinner, and I almost choked.
Why would they use KSP footage for this? I think this was actually from Scott Manley.
The Chinese did it - a supercomputer so powerful it can run KSP without lag!

The Chinese did it - a supercomputer so powerful it can run KSP without lag!
do you really believe they use KSP to simulate aircraft behavior? It would be hilarious but... Edited June 22, 2013 by Canopus
Will multiplayer be implemented?

You sure that's China?

If someone told me that this was North Korea's practice program I'd be quicker to believe it

Why would they use KSP footage for this? I think this was actually from Scott Manley.

I bet it was just an easy/cheap way to illustrate instead of using CGI.

At least they had the sense to run their advanced simulations with the B9 pack...

Agreed! Nobody should go without it.

Un-twist yer panties everyone.

The KSP footage was added by the news coverage and is not a program actually run by the supercomputer. Other news agencies reported the story, but none showed KSP. It's mostly city planning simulations.

http://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=China+builds+world%27s+fastest+supercomputer&oq=China+builds+world%27s+fastest+supercomputer&gs_l=youtube.12...2495.2495.0.3230.1.1.0.0.0.0.35.35.1.1.0...0.0...1ac.2.11.youtube.72gJzMozZzY

Un-twist yer panties everyone.

The KSP footage was added by the news coverage and is not a program actually run by the supercomputer. Other news agencies reported the story, but none showed KSP. It's mostly city planning simulations.

http://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=China+builds+world%27s+fastest+supercomputer&oq=China+builds+world%27s+fastest+supercomputer&gs_l=youtube.12...2495.2495.0.3230.1.1.0.0.0.0.35.35.1.1.0...0.0...1ac.2.11.youtube.72gJzMozZzY

Of course it was. Who would believe that the Chinese use this as simulation?

Of course it was. Who would believe that the Chinese use this as simulation?

I...I... Wanted to believe....

"In latest news, China's production of solid rocket fuel has increased by over 3000%. The new head of China's space programme, identifying himself as Dzhie Be Dia, justified this expense by claiming "moar boosters". When asked how this would impact the safety of the spacecraft being launched, the response was "space tape solves everything". Film at 11."

Of course it was. Who would believe that the Chinese use this as simulation?

That was the joke. buzzkill.

That was the joke. buzzkill.

Read the post i was quoting.
